head.title: NOV. 14-20: The N.J. Campaign; Rollins Says He Was Just Trying to Get Carville's Goat

hedline.hl1: NOV. 14-20: The N.J. Campaign; Rollins Says He Was Just Trying to Get Carville's Goat

block.p: Edward J. Rollins Jr., the Republican strategist who touched off a political wildfire with assertions that Republicans had spent $500,000 to suppress the urban black vote in the New Jersey gubernatorial race, tried to douse the flames during appearances last week before two groups of investigators: a Federal grand jury in Newark and attorneys for the state's Democratic Party.

Under oath, Mr. Rollins retracted the boasts he made to reporters in Washington on Nov. 9, calling his initial comments a flash of Beltway bravado and an attempt to needle his rival strategist in the Nov. 2 race, James Carville.

Edward J. Rollins Jr., the Republican strategist who touched off a political wildfire with assertions that Republicans had spent $500,000 to suppress the urban black vote in the New Jersey gubernatorial race, tried to douse the flames during appearances last week before two groups of investigators: a Federal grand jury in Newark and attorneys for the state's Democratic Party.

Under oath, Mr. Rollins retracted the boasts he made to reporters in Washington on Nov. 9, calling his initial comments a flash of Beltway bravado and an attempt to needle his rival strategist in the Nov. 2 race, James Carville.

"There was a subset game going on in this whole campaign," Mr. Rollins said under court-ordered questioning from Democratic Party lawyers. "It's never happened to me in any of the campaigns that I've ever been involved in, and it was the Carville/Rollins, the super-consultant game that was going on."
His denials apparently did little to put the matter to rest.

"There is no doubt that Ed Rollins did not give us the smoking gun," said the chairman of the New Jersey Democratic State Committee, State Senator Raymond J. Lesniak. "But I am not going to drop our investigation based on his bizarre explanation." JERRY GRAY
